column4: Then the fans need replacement; prefereably with a better quality unit with decent bearings.
I get a lot of dells and HPs with stuck fans.
If the fan is spinning slowly, User01, you should try to find a replacement cooler. And make sure you use good thermal compound like Artic Silver 5 or something
HAHAHAH yes! It IS! I HATE the DV series for that.
those cases are such PITAs.
the problem is, you have to get just the right MXM cooler for the right card
you're usually better off replacing the MXM card entirely sometimes, they're that model-specific.

It's not a matter of can, it's a matter of will/won't. I watched my ten year old niece build a beautiful amd desktop rig and install ubuntu on it, in less than an hour, with no help from me other than pointing out the little paper motherboard washers.
She could barely understand windows; and yet with nothing more than a phillips screwdriver and the instructions "everything only goes together one way, it's all logical, just take your time".
nice if that is true, what are the specs?
nice very nice I guess its possible if I can make the lil ones like ubuntu by removing any other OS choices I guess this is possible and they are dam happy about it :)
Eh, I just kill the top panel and set the bottom panel to resemble windows 7 and most of my users can barely tell the difference with crossover office and wine.
that could work if your users arent using apps like dreamweaver, expression web, CS* etc and your bothered to move the libraries over
They are. CS3.
that works well with wine? I am very surprised...
Nope -- crossover office for CS3.
Ahhh should've guess haven't used those in a long time why not just vm the window apps for all your users?
They complain about network performance of remote desktop solutions.
ah guess you can't make everyone happy I just tend to remove the option to make choices (that is when I can get away with it) either use it or don't simple as that
The other part is, I'm free to give them the finger and laugh in their face as well.
that could work I actually laughed how many times i've thought about doing the same, oh you just made my morning thanks
